Definition: Given two phrases (Head and Tail) separated by <sep>, you have to determine whether it is plausible for the Head to desire the Tail or not. "Yes" or "No" answers are required.
Domains: Commonsense -> Concepts and Relations -> Social Commonsense

Positive Examples.explanation: This is a good example. The Head desires the Tail.

Positive Examples.input: Head: PersonX accepts the offer<sep>Tail: smiles
Positive Examples.explanation: In this example, "PersonX accepts the offer desires smiles" doesn't make sense. So the output should be"No".
In this example, the person desires breakdance. Thus, this example should be classified as "Yes".

Negative Examples.input: Head: PersonX affords PersonY protection<sep>Tail: gets involved
Negative Examples.explanation: In this example, "PersonX affords PersonY protection desires getting involved" doesn't make sense. To have a positive answer, the Head should be an entity. So the output should be "No".
The person desires being promoted in the job, and the output should be "Yes".

Instances.input: Head: PersonX answers the door<sep>Tail: PersonX shuts door
Head: PersonX adjusts spacing as well as minimizing<sep>Tail: good
Head: PersonX asks ___ if PersonY could have one<sep>Tail: to help
Head: PersonX asks PersonY's mother for help<sep>Tail: Inquisitive
Head: person<sep>Tail: boss not being asshole
